description.narrative: The Project will refinance existing loans which funded the addition of sterile pharmaceutical manufacturing capacity and the acquisition of related pharmaceutical products which are supplied to emerging markets. This has allowed for an increase of available supplies of healthcare products to treat, inter alia, COVID-19 patients, including the supply of COVID-19 vaccines at a time where demand exceeds supply.

The proposed investment is an up to EUR600 million (approximately US$723 million) financing package comprising (i) an unsecured, straight senior loan (A loan) of up to EUR200 million (approximately US$241 million) from IFC and; (ii) mobilization of B and/or parallel loans of up to EUR400 million (approximately US$482 million) to Aspen Finance Proprietary Limited (AFPL), a wholly owned subsidiary of Aspen Pharmacare Holdings Limited (Aspen or the Company). The financing will help Aspen, South Africas largest pharmaceutical company, to refinance existing debt and strengthen the Companys balance sheet, supporting Aspens operations including production of vaccines, and other therapies in African and emerging markets.
